author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
Owners of power loom job working units who are on strike since January 28 have decided not to budge to any pressures to dilute their demands.

They want job work charges according to the agreement signed in 2014.

The unit owners stated that they arrears in the charges for the last two years too should be given.

“The three-year agreement signed by the units, and the textile units for production of fabrics promised a 27 per cent increase in charges. The increased rates were given only for the first few months,” said R. Velusamy, president of Tirupur District Job Work Power loom Weavers Association.

The stern stance of the job working units came close on the heels of negotiations convened by officials concerned on Thursday. Industry sources said that due to the strike by units in Tirupur, Avinashi, Palladam, and nearby areas, about 1.2 crore metres of fabric production was affected every day.
title: Will not buckle under pressure: striking units
